post.description: Place order to the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrow order id. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Place order to the Cross-margin or Isolated-margin trading system, you can place two major types of orders: limit and market. Orders can only be placed if your account has sufficient funds. Once an order is placed, your funds will be put on hold for the duration of the order. The amount of funds on hold depends on the order type and parameters specified.

clientOid.description:
Client Order Id，The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user（we recommend using a UUID）, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores （_）, and hyphens （-）. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/api-5176570) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in [Iceberg orders](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146)

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n seconds，the order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

isIsolated.description: true - isolated margin ,false - cross margin. defult as false

autoBorrow.description: When Margin Account has inefficient balance, our system autoborrows inefficient assets and opens positions according to the lowest market interest rate.

autoRepay.description: AutoPay allows returning borrowed assets when you close a position. Our system automatically triggers the repayment and the maximum repayment amount equals to the filled-order amount.

post.description: Order test endpoint, the request parameters and return parameters of this endpoint are exactly the same as the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct and other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: ID of the borrowing response. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Order test endpoint, the request parameters and return parameters of this endpoint are exactly the same as the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct and other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

Client Order Id，The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user（we recommend using a UUID）, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores （_）, and hyphens （-）. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

type.description:

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

hidden.description: [Hidden order](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) or not (not shown in order book)

delete.description: This endpoint can be used to cancel a margin order by orderId. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to websocket.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol

delete.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to cancel a margin order by orderId. This endpoint only sends cancellation requests. The results of the requests must be obtained by checking the order status or subscribing to websocket.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain information for a single Margin order using the order id.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

id.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

type.description: Specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

feeCurrency.description: currency used to calculate trading fee

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

visibleSize.description: Visible size of iceberg order in order book.

cancelAfter.description: A GTT timeInForce that expires in n seconds

clientOid.description: Client Order Id，unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: true: enter the orderbook; false: not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions need query this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order isactive; false-The status of the order is done

get.x-sdk-method-description: This endpoint can be used to obtain information for a single Margin order using the order id.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: symbol

get.description: This interface can query all Margin symbol that has active orders

parameters.description: Cross Margin: MARGIN_TRADE, Isolated Margin: MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE

symbols.description: The symbol that has active orders

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface can query all Margin symbol that has active orders

get.description: This interface is to obtain all Margin active order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Order type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trading order, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trading order

id.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

type.description: Specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

feeCurrency.description: currency used to calculate trading fee

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

visibleSize.description: Visible size of iceberg order in order book.

cancelAfter.description: A GTT timeInForce that expires in n seconds

clientOid.description: Client Order Id，unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: true: enter the orderbook; false: not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions need query this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order isactive; false-The status of the order is done

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is to obtain all Margin active order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

get.description: This interface is to obtain all Margin closed order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Transaction type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trade, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trade

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description:
The id of the last set of data from the previous batch of data. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId，which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default20，Max100

parameters.name: startAt
parameters.description: Start time (milisecond)

parameters.name: endAt
parameters.description: End time (milisecond)

lastId.description:
The id of the last set of data from the previous batch of data. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId，which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

feeCurrency.description: currency used to calculate trading fee

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into these strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

visibleSize.description: Visible size of iceberg order in order book.

cancelAfter.description: A GTT timeInForce that expires in n seconds

clientOid.description: Client Order Id，unique identifier created by the user

cancelExist.description: Whether there is a cancellation record for the order.

inOrderBook.description: Whether to enter the orderbook: true: enter the orderbook; false: not enter the orderbook

tax.description: Users in some regions need query this field

active.description: Order status: true-The status of the order isactive; false-The status of the order is done

get.x-sdk-method-description: This interface is to obtain all Margin closed order lists, and the return value of the active order interface is the paged data of all uncompleted order lists. The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.  After the user successfully places an order, the order is in Active state, and the user can use inOrderBook to determine whether the order has entered the order. Canceled or fully filled orders are marked as completed Done status.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to obtain a list of the latest Margin transaction details.  The returned data is sorted in descending order according to the latest update time of the order.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: symbol

parameters.name: tradeType
parameters.description: Trade type: MARGIN_TRADE - cross margin trade, MARGIN_ISOLATED_TRADE - isolated margin trade

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description:
The unique order id generated by the trading system
(If orderId is specified，please ignore the other query parameters)

parameters.name: side
parameters.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description:
The id of the last set of data from the previous batch of data. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId，which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default100，Max200

parameters.name: startAt
parameters.description: Start time (milisecond)

parameters.name: endAt
parameters.description: End time (milisecond)

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system

feeCurrency.description: currency used to calculate trading fee

stop.description: Take Profit and Stop Loss type, currently HFT does not support the Take Profit and Stop Loss type, so it is empty

tax.description: Users in some regions need query this field

taxRate.description: Tax Rate, Users in some regions need query this field

type.description: Specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order.

lastId.description:
The id of the last set of data from the previous batch of data. By default, the latest information is given.
lastId is used to filter data and paginate. If lastId is not entered, the default is a maximum of 100 returned data items. The return results include lastId，which can be used as a query parameter to look up new data from the next page.

clientOid.description:
Client Order Id，The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user（we recommend using a UUID）, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores （_）, and hyphens （-）. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

timeInForce.description: [Time in force](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/doc-338146) is a special strategy used during trading

postOnly.description: passive order labels, this is disabled when the order timing strategy is IOC or FOK

hidden.description: Hidden or not (not shown in order book)

iceberg.description: Whether or not only visible portions of orders are shown in iceberg orders

visibleSize.description: Maximum visible quantity in iceberg orders

cancelAfter.description: Cancel after n seconds，the order timing strategy is GTT

funds.description: When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds

autoBorrow.description: When Margin Account has inefficient balance, our system autoborrows inefficient assets and opens positions according to the lowest market interest rate.

autoRepay.description: AutoPay allows returning borrowed assets when you close a position. Our system automatically triggers the repayment and the maximum repayment amount equals to the filled-order amount.

marginModel.description: The type of trading, including cross (cross mode) and isolated (isolated mode). It is set at cross by default.

post.description: Order test endpoint, the request parameters and return parameters of this endpoint are exactly the same as the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct and other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

orderId.description: The unique order id generated by the trading system,which can be used later for further actions such as canceling the order.

loanApplyId.description: Borrow order id. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

borrowSize.description: Borrowed amount. The field is returned only after placing the order under the mode of Auto-Borrow.

post.x-sdk-method-description: Order test endpoint, the request parameters and return parameters of this endpoint are exactly the same as the order endpoint, and can be used to verify whether the signature is correct and other operations. After placing an order, the order will not enter the matching system, and the order cannot be queried.

clientOid.description:
Client Order Id，The ClientOid field is a unique ID created by the user（we recommend using a UUID）, and can only contain numbers, letters, underscores （_）, and hyphens （-）. This field is returned when order information is obtained. You can use clientOid to tag your orders. ClientOid is different from the order ID created by the service provider. Please do not initiate requests using the same clientOid. The maximum length for the ClientOid is 40 characters.

Please remember the orderId created by the service provider, it used to check for updates in order status.

side.description: specify if the order is to 'buy' or 'sell'

type.description:
specify if the order is an 'limit' order or 'market' order. 

The type of order you specify when you place your order determines whether or not you need to request other parameters and also affects the execution of the matching engine.

When placing a limit order, you must specify a price and size. The system will try to match the order according to market price or a price better than market price. If the order cannot be immediately matched, it will stay in the order book until it is matched or the user cancels.

Unlike limit orders, the price for market orders fluctuates with market prices. When placing a market order, you do not need to specify a price, you only need to specify a quantity. Market orders are filled immediately and will not enter the order book. All market orders are takers and a taker fee will be charged.

stp.description: [Self Trade Prevention](https://www.kucoin.com/docs-new/api-5176570) is divided into four strategies: CN, CO, CB , and DC

price.description:
Specify price for order

When placing a limit order, the price must be based on priceIncrement for the trading pair. The price increment (priceIncrement) is the price precision for the trading pair. For example, for the BTC-USDT trading pair, the priceIncrement is 0.00001000. So the price for your orders cannot be less than 0.00001000 and must be a multiple of priceIncrement. Otherwise, the order will return an invalid priceIncrement error.

size.description:
Specify quantity for order

When **type** is limit, size refers to the amount of trading targets (the asset name written in front) for the trading pair. Teh Size must be based on the baseIncrement of the trading pair. The baseIncrement represents the precision for the trading pair. The size of an order must be a positive-integer multiple of baseIncrement and must be between baseMinSize and baseMaxSize.

When **type** is market, select one out of two: size or funds
